text: Monster is an album by American jazz organist Jimmy Smith arranged by Oliver Nelson.Discogs accessed March 20, 2015 On the Billboard albums chart, Monster peaked at number 35, and at 5 on the top R&B; albums chart. Writer Gerald Majer critiqued Monster in his 2013 book of essays, The Velvet Lounge: On Late Chicago Jazz. ==Reception== AllMusic awarded the album two stars and its review by Scott Yanow stated that: ==Track listing== # "Goldfinger (Part 1)" (Anthony Newley, John Barry, Leslie Bricusse) – 2:45 # "Goldfinger (Part 2)" (Newley, Barry, Bricusse) – 2:45 # "St. James Infirmary Blues" (Joe Primose) – 6:00 # "Gloomy Sunday" (Rezső Seress, Sam M. Lewis) – 5:00 # "Theme From Bewitched" (Howard Greenfield, Jack Keller) – 3:04 # "Theme From The Munsters" (Jack Marshall) – 3:30 # "Theme From The Man with the Golden Arm" (Elmer Bernstein) – 4:30 # "The Creeper" (Oliver Nelson) – 5:30 # "Monlope" (Jimmy Smith) – 6:15 ==Personnel== ===Musicians=== * Jimmy Smith – organ * Oliver Nelson – arranger, conductor * Richard Davis – double bass * Grady Tate – drums * Kenny Burrell – guitar * Warren Smith – percussion * Robert Ashton – saxophone * Budd Johnson, Jerome Richardson, Phil Woods, Danny Banks, Raymond Beckenstein, George Dorsey, Harvey Estrin – wind instruments ===Technical=== * Creed Taylor – producer * Rudy Van Gelder – engineer * Val Valentin – director of engineering * John Henry, Chuck Stewart – photography * Johnny Magnus – liner notes ==Chart performance== ===Album=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Chart (1965) !Peak position !Total weeks |- |align="left"|U.S. Billboard 200 | style="text-align:center;"|35 | style="text-align:center;"|24 |} ==References== Category:1965 albums Category:Jimmy Smith (musician) albums Category:Albums arranged by Oliver Nelson Category:Albums produced by Rudy Van Gelder Category:Albums recorded at Van Gelder Studio Category:Verve Records albums
title: Monster (Jimmy Smith album)
